intro: Reseda gayana var. trigyna, commonly known as the three-toothed reseda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with three distinct lobes at the base, giving it its common name. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate blooms.
